verse.speaker: ALL
verse.line: In nineteenth-century Russia, we write letters
What is happening in our minds

verse.speaker: ALL
verse.line: Once it's on the paper, we feel better
It's like some kind of clarity
When the letter's done and signed

verse.speaker: PIERRE
verse.line: Do we march on the French splendidly?
Do our cannons crack and cry?
Do our bullets whistle and sing?
Does the air reek with smoke?

verse.speaker: PIERRE
verse.line: He will be all right, the good man
Your bride to be, so full of life and mischief
I hear she is more beautiful than ever
How I envy you and your happiness

verse.speaker: PIERRE
verse.line: Here at home I drink and read and drink and read and drink
But I think I've finally found it

verse.speaker: PIERRE
verse.line: For I've been studying the Kabal
And I've calculated the number of the beast
Six hundred three score and six
And I will kill him one day
None of us are great men
We're caught in the wave of history
Oh, if only I could not see "it"

verse.speaker: ALL
verse.line: In nineteenth-century Russia, we write letters
What is happening in our minds

verse.speaker: NATASHA
verse.line: What am I to do if I love him and the other one too?

verse.speaker: NATASHA
verse.line: I see nothing but the candle in the mirror

verse.speaker: MARY
verse.line: I am in deep despair at the misunderstanding there is between us
Whatever my father's feelings might be
I beg you to believe that I cannot help loving you
He is a tired old man and must be forgiven

verse.speaker: NATASHA
verse.line: Oh, what am I to write!
I shall never be happy again

verse.speaker: NATASHA
verse.line: I see nothing but the candle in the mirror

verse.speaker: ANATOLE
verse.line: A letter from him, from the man that I love

verse.speaker: ANATOLE
verse.line: I must love you or die
If you love me, say yes
And I will come and steal you away
Steal you out of the dark

verse.speaker: NATASHA
verse.line: How else could I have his letter in my hand?
I love him, I love him
